skillsText: I've been exploring the world of web development for nearly 2 years now. Here are the skills I've learned along the way. I'm always looking to learn more though ðŸ˜‰.

budgetApp.name: Pocket
budgetApp.description: This is my first full-stack project in MERN stack which i built to take my web development skills to another level. Pocket is a personal finance manager that lets you set budgets for your different expenses. You can easily record and keep track of your expense patterns and your income flow through an intuitive UI. In addition, Pocket allows you to analyze your previous cash flow with charts and visualizations. Pocket features a smooth, user-friendly and clean design. It won't let you miss a penny!

translateApp.name: Translate App
translateApp.description: I built this translate app to test my skills with React. This app lets you translate between over 100 languages. You can type in to translate any text, and see or hear the translation in your desired language. The user can also switch between languages, paste or copy text with a single tap. In addition, you can access your previous translation history. This app is accurate, user-friendly, and featues a clean design. Make sure to give it a try!

weatherApp.name: Weather App
weatherApp.description: I built this weather app with an eye on simplicity to avoid using the over-engineered weather websitesðŸ˜…. This simple and elegant web app, gives you the current weather and forecast for any location in the world. You can see the temperature, humidity, wind speed, pressure, precipitation, and other details and get an hourly or a 15-day forecast as well. You can also switch between Celsius and Fahrenheit units too.

noteApp.name: Note App
noteApp.description: Note is a simple yet functional app for creating, editing, and managing text notes. You can use it to jot down a quick to-do list, a shopping list, a personal diary, or anything else. This mini-app allows you to organize them by categories and easily search for notes by keywords. It is responsive, user-friendly, and supports night-mode. As a bigginer, I learned a lot about CSS and Javascript in the end.

stopWatchApp.name: Stopwatch App
stopWatchApp.description: Stopwatch is a web app that lets you measure time with ease. Whether you need to track your workouts, your cooking, your games, or anything else, Stopwatch has you covered. You can start, stop, and reset the timer with a single tap, and also record multiple laps. This is one of my first web apps which greatly helped me learn more about Javascript
